00:00:01:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:01:180000.Dialogue: Hey. So you guys ready to order?

00:00:03:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:03:110000.Dialogue: Since we come in every Tuesday night at 6:00 and order the same exact thing, and it's now 6:08, I believe your question not only answers itself but also stands alongside such other nonsensical queries as "Who let the dogs out?" and, uh, "How are they hanging""

00:00:21:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:21:040000.Dialogue: Okay. So, the usual, with extra spit on Sheldon's hamburger.

00:00:26:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:26:040000.Dialogue: Penny, a moment? Do you have plans this weekend?

00:00:30:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:30:100000.Dialogue: Oh, gee, Amy, I'm sorry, I'm actually pretty busy this weekend.

00:00:32:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:32:220000.Dialogue: Probably serving food that was ordered today.

00:00:36:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:36:170000.Dialogue: That's too bad. I was hoping you could be my plus-one at the Institute of Interdisciplinary Studies' symposium on the impact of current scientific research on societal interactions.

00:00:49:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:49:010000.Dialogue: It's an annual science conference. We've all been invited to speak.

00:00:52:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:52:010000.Dialogue: Oh! Oh, okay, well, you know, like I said, I have plans, so...

00:00:55:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:55:060000.Dialogue: Shame. Since you're my best friend, I thought it would be a good bonding opportunity.

00:01:03:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:03:150000.Dialogue: Oh, don't feel bad. I never read Leonard's, and I used to sleep with him.

00:01:11:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:11:070000.Dialogue: Do you know anybody else who would appreciate an all-expense-paid spa weekend at a four-star resort in Big Sur?

00:01:16:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:16:020000.Dialogue: No, I really-- I'm sorry, free what? Sorry, what, what?

00:01:18:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:18:230000.Dialogue: I think her weekend just opened up.

00:01:21:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:21:010000.Dialogue: Wait, wait, just to be clear, when you guys say "spa," does that mean the same thing as when regular people say it?

00:01:27:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:27:120000.Dialogue: Pretty much. Except we keep our shirts on in the sauna.

00:01:31:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:31:120000.Dialogue: You know, it is going to be difficult, but I'm going to cancel my plans so I can do this for my bestie.

00:01:41:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:41:110000.Dialogue: All right. I just want to establish boundaries.

00:01:44:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:44:040000.Dialogue: Boy, this is great. I haven't had a vacation in ages.

00:01:46:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:46:210000.Dialogue: In order to take a vacation, one first has to work.

00:01:50:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:50:060000.Dialogue: You know, for a smart guy, you really seem to have a hard time grasping the concept don't piss off the people who handle the things you eat.

00:01:57:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:57:170000.Dialogue: That does seem to be a valid principle.

00:02:00:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:00:210000.Dialogue: I trust Penny will adhere to the "Official California Restaurant Workers' Solemn Oath of Ethics and Cleanliness."

00:02:07:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:07:060000.Dialogue: I don't believe there's any such thing.

00:02:10:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:10:140000.Dialogue: You lied to me? Good morning. If I could have everyone's attention, please? I know we're all eager to get on the road to Big Sur, so if we focus, I'm sure we can get through this orientation in under a half an hour.

00:02:49:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:49:210000.Dialogue: Then it's just Q&A, quiz, safety drills, pose for commemorative group photo and we're off.

00:02:55:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:55:120000.Dialogue: Don't worry. Just sit next to me during the quiz, and you can copy my answers.

00:03:00:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:00:150000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Raj? What are you doing? I don't think so.

00:03:06:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:06:100000.Dialogue: You've had your allotted six ounces. The first bathroom break isn't until the Denny's located near Bakersfield, which is approximately two and half hours away. Remember, people, we're only as strong as our weakest bladder.

00:03:22:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:22:140000.Dialogue: Nobody cares about your Kegel exercises.

00:03:26:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:26:140000.Dialogue: All right. We have seven people, and two cars. In the lead car, driven by Leonard, will be... myself, Amy Farrah Fowler, and Penny.

00:03:41:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:41:100000.Dialogue: Yes! He had you in the other car, but I got you upgraded.

00:03:50:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:50:030000.Dialogue: She made the case that if we break down in the middle of nowhere, your Nebraska backwoods skills and brawny hands will give us the best chance to survive in the wild.

00:04:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:04:230000.Dialogue: Red Leader to Red Five, come in. Red Leader to Red Five, come in. Howard, you promised.

00:04:17:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:17:010000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ (on radio): Fine. Red Five to Red Leader. What do you want now?

00:04:20:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:20:130000.Dialogue: It's 11:15. I'm requesting your quarter-hourly location update.

00:04:27:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:27:190000.Dialogue: Copy that, Red Five. Radio contact is sufficient. No need to extend your middle finger.

00:04:35:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:35:230000.Dialogue: So, Amy, I've been wondering, are you and Sheldon going to be sharing a room?

00:04:41:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:41:100000.Dialogue: No, we discussed it. We decided we didn't want to jeopardize our relationship by getting to know each other too well.

00:04:48:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:48:090000.Dialogue: Indeed. Nothing sours a friendship more than over-familiarity with someone's toilet routine.

00:05:04:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:04:190000.Dialogue: Don't worry, Penny. You're my plus-one. You'll bunk with me. And FYI, travel makes me constipated, so I'm the ideal hotel roommate.

00:05:19:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:19:220000.Dialogue: I hope we get there in time to see the keynote address.

00:05:23:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:23:020000.Dialogue: Really? You want to see the keynote?

00:05:25:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:25:120000.Dialogue: Yeah, it sounds fun. Super bacteria: global apocalypse or exciting research opportunity?

00:05:32:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:32:100000.Dialogue: Actually, I was thinking we could go straight to the room and... take a nap.

00:05:41:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:41:010000.Dialogue: We can watch it later on C-SPAN. Besides, I was really looking forward to you and me... napping together in the hotel.

00:05:47:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:47:230000.Dialogue: Honey, if you're that tired, why don't you just take a nap here in the car?

00:05:52:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:52:100000.Dialogue: No, see, it's not... (cell phone ringing)

00:05:54:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:54:020000.Dialogue: Hang on. It's Leonard. Hi, Leonard.

00:05:58:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:58:000000.Dialogue: LEONARD (on speaker): Yeah, hi. Listen, I just got a text from Raj. He wanted me to tell you that when Howard says "nap," he means "sex."

00:06:10:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:10:110000.Dialogue: Are you... an element in the actinoid series?

00:06:16:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:16:190000.Dialogue: Are you usually radioactive when found in nature?

00:06:20:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:20:230000.Dialogue: Are you in the lanthanoid series?

00:06:27:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:27:110000.Dialogue: Uh, I don't know... Are you food?

00:06:33:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:33:170000.Dialogue: That's not apropos. We've already established I'm found in the periodic table.

00:06:39:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:39:000000.Dialogue: Well, it's a table, right? I mean, why can't there be food on it?

00:06:43:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:43:060000.Dialogue: I knew she wasn't lead car materiel.

00:06:46:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:46:100000.Dialogue: Who elected you Road Trip God?

00:06:54:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:54:170000.Dialogue: We were all exhausted, and he was threatening to filibuster. It's not technically "Road Trip God"" it's Travel Supervisor.

00:07:01:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:01:180000.Dialogue: Although Road Trip God does have a certain ring to it.

00:07:05:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:05:200000.Dialogue: I don't understand why you people just let him bully you like this. Someone should stand up to him. What's he going to do?

00:07:14:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:14:050000.Dialogue: I can't believe you let him kick me out of the car.

00:07:17:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:17:120000.Dialogue: What could we do? He's the Travel Supervisor.

00:07:21:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:21:230000.Dialogue: Don't worry, Penny. This is a better car anyway.

00:08:08:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:08:020000.Dialogue: You know what? I missed you, too. Bernadette?

00:08:17:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:17:170000.Dialogue: Are you here for the conference?

00:08:19:160000.Speaker: Glenn
00:08:19:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, I'm doing a global warming panel.

00:08:21:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:21:150000.Dialogue: Oh, good for you. Uh, Glenn, this is my boyfriend Howard.

00:08:29:050000.Speaker: Glenn
00:08:29:050000.Dialogue: You're a lucky man. Bernie's a great gal.

00:08:36:030000.Speaker: Glenn
00:08:36:030000.Dialogue: Well, I got to run. The panel's tomorrow morning. It's called, "Remembering Snow: A Look Back."

00:08:52:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:52:190000.Dialogue: Please tell me he's your gay cousin.

00:08:56:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:56:040000.Dialogue: No. He was one of my professors in college.

00:09:03:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:09:03:190000.Dialogue: Then we went out for a year.

00:09:06:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:09:06:150000.Dialogue: Come on, let's check in, so we can take that nap.

00:09:12:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:12:220000.Dialogue: No, it's not necessarily proportional... Shut up!

00:09:23:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:23:030000.Dialogue: That green bag is Dr. Cooper's. Here's an extra five. Make him wait.

00:09:30:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:30:200000.Dialogue: Oh. Right to the nap, huh? Okay?

00:09:36:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:36:000000.Dialogue: Uh, so, this Glenn guy. You say you went out with him for, like, a year.

00:09:41:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:09:41:030000.Dialogue: Do we really need to talk about my old boyfriend now?

00:09:47:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:47:060000.Dialogue: What is he, like, six-four, six-five?

00:09:51:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:51:180000.Dialogue: Probably has a hard time finding a suit that fits.

00:10:00:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:00:190000.Dialogue: I'm just thinking. If you had sex with that guy, I mean, there's nothing I can do here that will make any kind of... impact.

00:10:10:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:10:170000.Dialogue: Howard, it's not a contest. I love you. I want to be with you.

00:10:14:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:14:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, great, love you, too, but... If it were a contest, I wouldn't have a chance, right?

00:10:31:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:31:020000.Dialogue: Sorry. I just never figured that a guy like me going out with a girl like you would ever have to compete with a guy like that.

00:10:39:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:39:010000.Dialogue: Wait a minute, "a girl like me"? What's that mean?

00:10:48:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:48:070000.Dialogue: Are you saying you don't think I'm hot enough to go out with a guy like Glenn?

00:10:51:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:51:180000.Dialogue: No! No, I'm saying exactly the opposite.

00:10:54:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:54:170000.Dialogue: I'm too hot to go out with a guy like Glenn?

00:11:12:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:12:070000.Dialogue: Remind me to try again in an hour.

00:11:22:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:22:050000.Dialogue: Um, sure. What do you got in mind?

00:11:25:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:25:200000.Dialogue: Do you subscribe to the Freudian theory of penis envy?

00:11:31:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:31:040000.Dialogue: Um, I never really thought about it. Why?

00:11:34:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:34:230000.Dialogue: Sometimes I think it might be nice to have one.

00:11:39:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:39:040000.Dialogue: Not for sex, for convenience. You can't deny that, by comparison, our internal plumbing is extremely high maintenance.

00:11:46:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:46:210000.Dialogue: Again, I've never given it much thought.

00:11:50:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:50:230000.Dialogue: We have time now. Think about it.

00:12:04:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:04:180000.Dialogue: Howard's a complete and total ass.

00:12:07:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:07:100000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, that. Come on in.

00:12:10:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:10:220000.Dialogue: Thanks. I'll sleep on the floor.

00:12:12:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:12:200000.Dialogue: Not necessary. Penny and I are perfectly comfortable sharing a bed.

00:12:24:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:24:090000.Dialogue: Word of warning, though. I'm prone to night terrors, so when I wake up kicking and screaming, don't panic. Just pin me down and stroke my hair, and I'll be fine.

00:12:38:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:38:100000.Dialogue: Hey, can I stay here tonight?

00:12:43:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:43:090000.Dialogue: Well, Howard's a complete and total ass, Bernadette's in my bed, and no matter how much you stroke Amy's hair, she bites.

00:13:00:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:00:070000.Dialogue: So, how do you want to do this?

00:13:02:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:02:070000.Dialogue: Well, I'm not getting in bed with him.

00:13:06:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:06:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, it is a little like getting into Dracula's coffin.

00:13:09:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:09:020000.Dialogue: We're just gonna have to make the best of this.

00:13:13:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:13:220000.Dialogue: Okay, when you say "make the best of it..."

00:13:18:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:18:180000.Dialogue: So we'll just call the middle here the Neutral Zone.

00:13:25:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:25:040000.Dialogue: Star Trek. You know, the Neutral Zone between the Federation and the Romulan Empire.

00:13:31:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:31:100000.Dialogue: Oh, okay. Just like old times.

00:13:40:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:40:150000.Dialogue: Of course, sometimes the Federation and the Romulans would enter the Neutral Zone to negotiate a temporary truce.

00:13:49:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:49:140000.Dialogue: Sweetie, let me put this in a way you'll understand: from the waist down, my shields are up.

00:13:57:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:57:060000.Dialogue: Got it, got it. We can do all kinds of stuff from the waist up, you know?

00:14:14:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:200000.Dialogue: Please tell me you're not having coitus.

00:14:22:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:22:230000.Dialogue: Can you guarantee that it won't happen at any time during the night?

00:14:39:020000.Speaker: TV Announcer
00:14:39:020000.Dialogue: ANNOUNCER (on TV): Next on Turner Classic Movies, Bridget Jones's Diary.

00:14:43:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:43:200000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, I'm crying already.

00:14:48:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:48:230000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Raj? Raj? Raj? I need to sleep here tonight.

00:15:00:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:00:170000.Dialogue: Howard is a complete and total ass, Bernadette is in Penny's bed, Amy bites, and Penny may or may not have coitus with Leonard.

00:15:17:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:17:230000.Dialogue: I really appreciate you letting me stay here tonight.

00:15:28:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:28:040000.Dialogue: I've gotten a lot more street since we broke up.

00:15:34:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:34:060000.Dialogue: Right. Still mad at me about that?

00:15:38:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:38:080000.Dialogue: No. No, I understand. I got too intense, you had to back off.

00:15:46:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:46:150000.Dialogue: I've gotten a lot better at that, you know. I've dated four different women since we broke up and I didn't tell any of them that I loved them and wanted to have their babies.

00:16:03:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:03:050000.Dialogue: Good night. You know, maybe it wouldn't be the worst idea in the world to violate the Neutral Zone for just one night. Oh!

00:16:18:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:18:230000.Dialogue: Hey, Leonard, Sheldon kicked me out of the room, gave me your key.

00:16:29:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:29:040000.Dialogue: No, we don't want to watch Bridget Jones's Diary!

00:16:39:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:39:050000.Dialogue: Good morning and welcome to Science and Society. I'm Dr. Sheldon Cooper, BS, MS, MA, PhD, and ScD. OMG, right?

00:16:55:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:55:150000.Dialogue: Perhaps that joke was a little too hippie-dippy for this crowd. All right then, we'll begin with opening remarks. Miss Rostenkowski, would you like to start us off by discussing your assessment of science's responsibility to society?

00:17:09:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:09:070000.Dialogue: Sure. I think all branches of science have to move cautiously these days. It's not just giant nuclear weapons that can destroy the world. As a microbiologist, I can tell you even the tiniest organisms can still tear you a new one.

00:17:28:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:28:020000.Dialogue: Interesting. I think what you might need to know about my colleague is that though she claims her field of interest is tiny organisms, she certainly has spent her fair share of time around what we can assume was pretty massive weaponry.

00:17:46:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:46:170000.Dialogue: I think Mr. Wolowitz needs to keep in mind that the past is the past. But he should know that I am the kind of girl who could get all the giant missiles she wants.

00:18:00:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:00:190000.Dialogue: Are we talking about women wanting penises? Because I'd like to weigh in.

00:18:12:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:12:100000.Dialogue: Dr. Koothrappali, would you care to join the conversation?

00:18:15:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:15:080000.Dialogue: Certainly. I'd like to raise two points. Number one, I think they are talking about penises.

00:18:24:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:24:030000.Dialogue: And number two, these mimosas are kicking my little brown ass.

00:18:31:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:31:070000.Dialogue: I'd like to kick your little brown ass.

00:18:35:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:35:050000.Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. Maybe when you walk into a hotel room and you see a guy getting back together with his girlfriend, you should consider doing something other than crawling into the adjoining bed.

00:18:45:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:45:220000.Dialogue: I did. You said no Bridget Jones.

00:18:48:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:48:230000.Dialogue: PENNY: We weren't getting back together! It was a one-time thing!

00:18:54:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:54:100000.Dialogue: Excuse me. We're not taking comments or questions from the audience just yet.

00:19:04:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:04:010000.Dialogue: All right, why don't we see if we can bring this back to topic.

00:19:08:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:08:010000.Dialogue: Let me ask you something, Bernie.

00:19:11:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:11:040000.Dialogue: How would you feel if you met my ex-girlfriend and she was like Angelina Jolie?

00:19:16:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:16:190000.Dialogue: Oh, come on, Howard, be realistic.

00:19:21:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:21:120000.Dialogue: What, I'm not hot enough for Angelina Jolie?

00:19:27:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:27:010000.Dialogue: I'd like to weigh in here. No.

00:19:33:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:33:130000.Dialogue: All right, why don't we open it up to Q&A from the audience?

00:19:36:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:36:060000.Dialogue: PENNY: Yeah, I have a question. Is there anybody who can get me the hell out of here and back to Los Angeles tonight?

00:19:42:070000.Speaker: Glenn
00:19:42:070000.Dialogue: GLENN: I'm driving back to L.A. tonight.

00:19:47:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:47:040000.Dialogue: Penny, that's Glenn. Glenn, that's Penny.

00:20:01:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:01:010000.Dialogue: SHELDON (over radio): Red Leader to Red Five. Red Leader to Red Five. Anybody up for a little game?

00:20:10:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:10:120000.Dialogue: I spy with my little eye... a nonferrous metal.

00:20:25:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:25:120000.Dialogue: Leonard, can I ask you a question?

00:20:28:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:28:220000.Dialogue: Are you bothered by the fact that your former girlfriend left the symposium with what is probably the most beautiful man I've ever seen in my life?

00:20:39:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:39:010000.Dialogue: Because we're going 120 miles per hour.

00:20:43:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:43:230000.Dialogue: All right, if no one's going to guess... I was spying the aluminum rims on the police car we passed a few miles back. (siren wailing)
